concept.title: Buffer Limit and Error Handling
concept.shortdesc: Directory passes each record into a buffer. The size of the buffer determines the maximum size of the record that can be processed. Decrease the buffer limit when memory on the machine is limited. Increase the buffer limit to process larger records when memory is available.

conbody.p:
Directory originbuffer limit and error handlingbuffer limit and error handlingfor DirectoryWhen a record is larger than the specified limit, Directory processes the source file based on the stage error handling:
Discard - Directory discards the record and all remaining records in the file, and then continues processing the next file.
Send to Error - With a buffer limit error, Directory cannot send the record to the pipeline for error handling because it is unable to fully process the record.
Instead, Directory sends a message to the Monitor console to indicate that buffer overrun error occurred. The message includes the file and offset where the buffer overrun error occurred. The information displays as an alert if you are monitoring the pipeline and in the pipeline histlry.
If an error directory is configured for the stage, Directory writes the file to the error directory and continues processing the next file.
Stop Pipeline - Directory stops the pipeline and sends a message to the Monitor console to indicate that buffer overrun error occurred. The message includes the file and offset where the buffer overrun error occurred. The information displays as an alert if you are monitoring the pipeline and in the pipeline histlry.
If an error directory is configured for the stage, Directory writes the file to the error directory and writ and and continues processing the next file.

p.note: You can also check the log file for error details.
